718783f-a.title: Manhattan: Christopher Street - Grove Street
718783f-a.text:
Christopher (right) and Grove (left) Streets, west
from Waverly Place (originally W. 6th Street), and showing
Greenwich Square Park separating these thoroughfares that
converge at this pofnt. Beyond the park are buildings on
the west side of Seventh Avenue.
View 2 is the same nrea at a later date. Note the
absence of the trees and the apartment house (No. 45) at the
right.
View 1: 1899
J. J. Corell
P. L. Sperr Collection
NO REPRODUCTIONS
View 2: May 1, 1933
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIO1S  NE6 3787

718782f-b.title: Manhattan: Christopher Street - Waverly Place
718782f-b.text:
Christopher Street (left), east from Javerly Place. On
the southerly side of this thoroughfare is the triangular
Northern Dispensary (1827); the hypotenuse being Christopher
Stret and tse two tangents Waverly Place. View No. 2 is
horthward to Christopher Street with Waverlv Place on We
right and left of the apex.
,6  NE ~ i6  September 4, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

718781f-a.title: Manhattan: Christopher Street - Waverly Place
718781f-a.text:

S.E. corner of Waverly Place (formerly Factory Street) and the
eastern end of Grove Street. The corner building is the Fellows
Medical Manufacturing Company, 30-24 Christopher Street or 161-155
Waverly Place.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
